text: Differential interaction of nuclear factors with the PRE-I enhancer element of the human <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter in different T cell subsets .
The immunomodulatory cytokine <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> affects cells of most hemopoietic lineages .

<extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is secreted by activated Th2 but not Th1 cells and plays a major role in the immune response by modulating the differentiation of naive Th cells toward the Th2 phenotype .
We have previously identified an enhancer element , PRE-I , that is essential for the function of the human <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

To investigate the mechanisms responsible for tissue - specific expression of the <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene , we analyzed nuclear factors binding to the PRE-I site and compared the binding activities of these factors to the <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter of Th1 and Th2 cells .

text: We show that PRE-I interacts with PMA - and PMA / ionomycin - inducible , cyclosporin A - sensitive nuclear factors .

Using anti - <extra_id_0> C/EBPbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , anti - <extra_id_0> C/EBPdelta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> NF-IL6beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , anti - <extra_id_0> NF-ATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , anti - <extra_id_0> NF-ATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , anti-Fos , and anti-Jun Abs we demonstrate that the previously identified PRE-I binding factor POS-1 is composed of different transcription factors in different Th cell subsets .

In the <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - producing Th0-like human Jurkat and mouse EL-4 cells , POS-1 ( designated POS-1a ) contains <extra_id_0> NF-IL6beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and Jun .
In the mouse Th2 D10 cells and in the human Th2 clones , POS-1 ( designated POS-1b ) contains <extra_id_0> NF-IL6beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , Jun , and NF-ATc / p .
In contrast , POS-1 was not found in nuclear extracts of human Th1 clones .
These findings suggest that PRE-I may play a role in the differential regulation of <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression levels .
